
Two careless admins reused a prime to generate their RSA keys. Can you defeat their sloppy crypto and recover the flag encrypted as 7911643980669934374981302968261793468405884309248999688877963261636040657700244146381649294597261713808859380328771633186199805522993166025628303320878504?


The flag format is flag{...}
n=8826650629925632230852411443071356253012974030815858753503623644073937516341366443201222180302692653399633375493109841950681558926925109099174323152747109, n2=5359590424920189124162995297129966102435137534268343067669104710739036636252902808142003822063334559071479686850793353170325737174828269764699327491965619, e=3795946455187183855574752176533404696693027622012742869273568648041368673300349366477762540739903329639609780559753565032534675778177086389198966464522171

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{00zkjz3v}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 7911643980669934374981302968261793468405884309248999688877963261636040657700244146381649294597261713808859380328771633186199805522993166025628303320878504
vulnerability: shared prime
hint: When two RSA moduli share a common prime, computing GCD(n, n2) can reveal the shared prime factor.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=8826650629925632230852411443071356253012974030815858753503623644073937516341366443201222180302692653399633375493109841950681558926925109099174323152747109, n2=5359590424920189124162995297129966102435137534268343067669104710739036636252902808142003822063334559071479686850793353170325737174828269764699327491965619, e=3795946455187183855574752176533404696693027622012742869273568648041368673300349366477762540739903329639609780559753565032534675778177086389198966464522171
extra_info: p=76658687071297463899734248884649473422170894357341303513116380616839715217799, q=115142209802214388098551754978964558419719439476088077401579594468555128352691, q2=69914978062896231182161250796973502446296975374712627381421805030114919256181, φ(n)=8826650629925632230852411443071356253012974030815858753503623644073937516341174642304348668450694367395769761461267951616848129546010413124088928309176620, φ(n2)=5359590424920189124162995297129966102435137534268343067669104710739036636252756234476869628368252663571798063874924885300593683243933731579052372857491640
